DataElement.preferredDefinition: Side of lesion epicenter irrespective of whether the lesion crosses into the contralateral hemisphere.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._That part of the central nervous system contained within the cranium, comprising the prosencephalon, mesencephalon, and rhombencephalon. It is derived from the anterior part of the embryonic neural tube. Functions include muscle control and coordination, sensory reception and integration, speech production, memory storage, and the elaboration of thought and emotions._Foci; plural of focus; a central point or locus of an infection._One of the two lateral margins or surfaces of a body, midway between the front and back.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Property.preferredDefinition: That part of the central nervous system contained within the cranium, comprising the prosencephalon, mesencephalon, and rhombencephalon. It is derived from the anterior part of the embryonic neural tube. Functions include muscle control and coordination, sensory reception and integration, speech production, memory storage, and the elaboration of thought and emotions.:Foci; plural of focus; a central point or locus of an infection.:One of the two lateral margins or surfaces of a body, midway between the front and back.

Concepts.definition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.
Area of greatest concentration, attention, or activity; a central point or locus, especially of an infection.
One of the two lateral margins or surfaces of a body, midway between the front and back.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/16/11 - upd for VASARI 3.0 Key (1/14/2011); VD released.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Foci; plural of focus; a central point or locus of an infection._One of the two lateral margins or surfaces of a body, midway between the front and back._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Left; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Affecting both sides of the body, or a matched pair of organs.: A point or area that is approximately central within some larger region or structure.

Concepts.definition: Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.
A point or area that is approximately central within some larger region or structure.

Concepts.definition: Area of greatest concentration, attention, or activity; a central point or locus, especially of an infection.
One of the two lateral margins or surfaces of a body, midway between the front and back.
